comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: Three Douglas AD-6 Skyraider of VA-196 ‘Main Battery’ Aboard CVA-16 USS Lexington. Closest aircraft with tail code B of Air Task Group One (ATG-1) Modex 415 on nose and after size increase and close examination Navy serial beneath horizontal tailplane may be read as 137534 from a known AD-6 production batch In new Light Gull Gray and Insignia White scheme as applied to US Navy aircraft after 1955. ‘GO!NAVY’ deployment record for VA-196: www.gonavy.jp/navy/sqn/VA196.html Having made a designation and number change from VF-194 to VA-196, equipped with AD-6 Skyraiders, was assigned to ATG-1 aboard CVA-16 USS Lexington from 28 May to 20 December 1956 for a Western Pacific voyage. The code may have changed from B to letter U during the voyage. Undated picture of A-1H 137534 with VA-145 as Modex 508 of CVW-14 tail code NK possibly 1965-1966 groups.yahoo.com/group/PropNavy/attachments/folder/109738... 137534 NK-508 AD-6 VA-145 no date ‘GO!NAVY’ record of A-1H 137534 for 1966: www.gonavy.jp/CVW10-AK1966.html A-1H 137534 is recorded with VA-165 as Modex 206 CVS-11 USS INTREPID CVW-10 code AK 4 April 1966 to 21 November 1966 (information courtesy of Takafumi Hiroe, citizen of Japan and naval aviation historian) Unfortunately the aircraft was a casualty of war during this cruise. A-1H 137534 of VA-165 was hit by anti-aircraft fire while on a road reconnaissance mission near Vinh Son, 10 Miles West of Mu Ron Ma, Quang Binh Province, over heavily defended North Vietnam on September 2, 1966. Pilot, Commander William S Jett was able to fly out to the Gulf of Tonkin to become “feet wet” where he bailed out using the YANKEE extraction system and was rescued by a US Navy helicopter.

comment.author: 93106715@N06
comment._content:
The U.S. Navy didn't use the "Yankee" system. I was flying alongside Bill Jett's Skyraider, with the wing of it on fire, as I watched him bail out the old fashioned way. I provided cover for him until he was picked up, due to the fact that he was only a couple of miles offshore..
Lt. J.E.B. Stuart

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/93106715@N06] Thanks for that information and your service Lt. Stuart!
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment.author: 45586426@N06
comment._content: so much for info gleaned from the internet! Dear 'parkcityskier' - thank you for excellent and invaluable personal feedback picture of A-1H 137534 while with VA-145: dir.groups.yahoo.com/group/PropNavy/message/2506 groups.yahoo.com/group/PropNavy/attachments/folder/109738...
